KEGG.PathwayBrief.Description: Serine is derived from 3-phospho-D-glycerate, an intermediate of glycolysis [MD:M00020], and glycine is derived from serine. Threonine is an essential amino acid, which animals cannot synthesize. In bacteria and plants, threonine is derived from aspartate [MD:M00018].
KEGG.PathwayBrief.Name: Glycine, serine and threonine metabolism - Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzicola BLS256

hashEntry.Value: Threonine biosynthesis, aspartate => homoserine => threonine [PATH:xor00260]
